fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39974].
  {panel}

h4. Problem:
When a project is created all the project types available create corresponding workflow, workflow scheme, and issue type scheme which are then deleted and an existing workflow, workflow scheme, and issue type scheme are used in it's place.

h4. Suggestion:
Make creating a corresponding workflow, workflow scheme, and issue type scheme optional, give users the ability to select the defaults, and/or revive the "Blank Project" option.
fields.summary: Allow options for creating a corresponding workflow, workflow scheme, and issue type scheme upon project creation
/rest/api/2/serverInfo?doHealthCheck=true does not check the index state

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39972].
  {panel}

We need to update this page at 

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Performing+Text+Searches#PerformingTextSearches-EscapingSpecialCharactersor

JRA-25092 has been fixed so escaping should work correctly.

CC: [~wthompson]
fields.summary: Update Escaping Text Characters on JQL Instructions on CAC

fields.description:
If you try to create a project link using anonymous access, you get the attached error dialog, which has two problems:
# There is a "Create" button that looks enabled (it should either be greyed out or hidden, depending on our UI guidelines)
# The styling is off, to the point that the word "Help" overlaps the edge of the dialog

This happens in {{v6.3.5#6334-sha1:1cd0851}}.
fields.summary: Project link error dialog has "create" button and is badly styled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39970].
  {panel}

Jira needs a specific collation to make things work.

We should have a check that for every DB Engine the proper collation is used.

If not a BIG message should be written in the logs stating that some functionalities are not going to work because of this.

For the different DBs the collations are : 

* Oracle : BINARY
* Mysql: utf8_bin
* Postgres : C or POSIX
* SQL Server : SQL_Latin1_General_CP437_CI_AI or SQL_Latin1_General_CI_AI
* HSQLDB : TBD
fields.summary: Jira needs to check the collation of the DB before it starts

fields.description: when I click Notification Helper for a Issue,I can see the submit button and close link,but after I click submit button ,I can not see button and link anyway.
fields.summary: the Notification Helper for Issue can not find submit button and close link
Make JIRA Sizing Guide available to customers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39966].
  {panel}

With the removal of the JIRA Classic Project Template when new projects are created a new Issue Type Scheme and Workflow is also created, instead of the project inheriting the Default Issue Type Scheme and Workflow for the instance.

This causes additional work for users who already have a Default Issue Type Scheme and Workflow implemented and want to use that for all new projects, as users will have to switch back to the Defaults after the project gets created (and delete the newly create Issue Type Scheme and Workflow if they don't want to use it).

When creating a new project JIRA should give users at least three different options as for the Issue Type scheme and Workflow for the new project:

# Inherit the Default Issue Type Scheme and Workflow.
# Give users the option to select an existing Issue Type and Workflow.
# Give users the option to create new Issue Type Schemes and Workflow.

This will reduce friction when creating new projects.
fields.summary: New Projects no Longer Inherit the Default Issue Type Scheme and Default Workflow
"Create Issue" should prompt before closing (on "Cancel" or Esc)
Can no longer connect with Jira via NetBeans

fields.description: No one in our company can create a new project without errors.  Also some older projects are missing and the new ones that get errors cannot be created again.
fields.summary: Exception occurred while configuring the project template
Add an API endpoint for managing JIRA permission schemes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39959].
  {panel}

We use Confluence pages for our requirements/design. We have JIRA issues linked to them. We can see them in the little button/bubble on the Confluence page and when we open the actual issues.

BUT, what we need is traceability reporting. Either JIRA has to show linked pages in the issue filter area or Confluence has to improve the JIRA reporting to include the ability to choose to display or hide ALL linked types of items.

The tools are nice and easy to use, but it's hard to "prove" we have covered our requirements and addressed everything if we have to do this manually.

Thank you.

P.S. I have searched the web and the various Atlassian spots and cannot find an answer to this other than "make your own plugin" but we are in OnDemand/Cloud and have limited resources to make that happen.
fields.summary: Allow a column of Confluence page links to display in a JIRA filter

fields.description:
When running the code:

SearchResults results = searchProvider.searchOverrideSecurity(query, user, PagerFilter.getUnlimitedFilter(), null);

This works perfectly fine in JIRA Version up to 6.3. This works also in JIRA 6.3 in an ordinary request.

BUT!

When running this code, triggered from the new Scheduler API the query always return an empty result!! Is this a bug? Or do you have a workaround?

Thanks //Mathias
fields.summary: Search JQL from the new Scheduler API
Warning Message for License Limit

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39947].
  {panel}

In particular, attachments / screenshots generated in Windows using a program like [Altap Salamander|http://www.altap.cz/salamander/downloads/] (exported from .bmp to .jpg) display as an oddly tinted image when attached to JIRA.

Attempted to replicate by creating a .bmp attachment on my Mac and converting to .jpg but do not have the same problem. 

Am not able to determine what might cause this, but there may be other users that run into the issue.

Can confirm the same problem with both JIRA Server and JIRA Cloud.
fields.summary: Some generated screenshots display incorrect colors in a thumbnail

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39946].
  {panel}

Existing:
When we disable user by removing their access in JIRA or confluence, they are still visible when other users trying to comment against other users using @ expansion. 

Expected:
When commenting we should see only the active users for the project visible.
fields.summary: As an Administrator when I disable user they should not be listed when users commenting so that I can avoid user leaving comments against wrong IDs
License Panel Shows Support and Updates Available Until '83

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39941].
  {panel}

Add:

* the ability to stop issue links which do not meet pluggable conditions from being created
* force an issue link to be present upon creation of issues
* raise events upon on issue linking 
* raise events when links with other products (e.g. a Confluence page) is created
fields.summary: Stronger controls for issue linking
Fix concurrency issue in bulk edit

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39935].
  {panel}

We've been using JIRA for a long time, but I've always missed "refactoring" issue type. There is no ideal replacement:

bug - code in need of refactoring is not a bug
improvement/enhancement - refactoring does not bring any visible enhancements, users do not see it (usually)
feature request - no new feature added
task - too general
etc.
fields.summary: Add refactoring issue type
Add option to not retrieve Disabled users from the LDAP server

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce

# Install the Synapse RT plugin
# Create test cases in one issue
# Export the issue to word

h3. Current behaviour

The import form the table data of Synapse will be broken and not properly handled.

h3. Expected behaviour

Import the data properly as a table.

We are aware that Synapse RT is a third party plugin, but since the Word export is handled by JIRA and not by the plugin, it would be nice to render the table properly during the export.
fields.summary: Word export doesn't properly render tables
Transition labels in workflow editor
Text Formatting Notation - extLink in browsers other than IE

fields.description: From the page https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=links , the link to 'Docs' is a deadlink both in English and German, both on your website same as in our local host installation (JIRA 6.3). Please correct the path and make the page available again.
fields.summary: Text Formatting Notation - link to 'Docs' is deadlink
JIRA dashboard to have gadgets showing SLA information from Servicedesk
Attaching files to issue has inconsistent permission handling

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39919].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 22 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, the JIRA Markdown plugin is not actively maintained by the JIRA team. While we recognize that Markdown is very popular (and support it natively in our developer tools like Stash and Bitbucket), we're not ready to commit to official support of the plugin at this time.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

h3. Current situation

The [Markdown for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/atlassian-jira-markdown-plugin] is currently not compatible with the latest releases of JIRA.

h3. Expected behaviour

Keep the add-on as Labs but make the plugin compatible with the newest JIRA releases.
fields.summary: Markdown for JIRA Add-On compatibility

fields.description: If a JIRA site is behind SSL, and you add a web remote link to a non-SSL'ed site, it will produce mixed content warnings to users viewing the ticket when it attempts to fetch the site's favicon.
fields.summary: Remote links can produce mixed content warnings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39917].
  {panel}

h4. Problem: 
We need to add a permission level that prevents certain users from creating a dashboard that can be viewed by "everyone". We have different project/client teams and some of them are creating shared dashboards entitled to "everyone". Other clients are then able to view other client's code commits.

h4. Suggestion:
Add permissions for shared objects without having to lock down the "Create Shared Objects" global permission. 

Related to: JRA-28779
fields.summary: Restrict ability to create dashboards sharable to everyone

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39915].
  {panel}

The current screenshot of [JIRA's Default Workflow|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Workflow] shows the status "WAITING FOR TRIAGE" when this status is called "OPEN" in JIRA 6.3 Default Workflow.

This screenshot should be updated.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Workflow
https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/185729632/jira-defaultworkflow.png?version=3&modificationDate=1402559874735&api=v2&effects=border-simple,blur-border
fields.summary: Update JIRA "Configure Workflow" Documentation.
User should be able to use Bulk Change feature to convert multiple sub-tasks to issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39913].
  {panel}

h3. Actual Behaviour

When uninstalling a plugin, all it's tables still remain in the database and there are information in the instance as well. This could cause trouble when upgrading / migrating JIRA.

h3. Expected Behaviour

When uninstalling a plugin, the admin should have an option to export the existing data and remove the actual plugin data from the database as well.
fields.summary: Add ability to remove plugin's tables as well upon Uninstallation.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39912].
  {panel}

As mentioned in JRA-18076 and JRA-23255, the predefined group _anyone_ poses security risks in many cases as it exposes projects to unauthenticated users.

I tend to think that in 90% of Jira instances that group has no use and is just a security risk dangling over our heads.

I would suggest an option to enable that group so it is not possible to share a filter or give a permission to _anyone_ unless the group is _enabled_ through that new option.

By default, it should be disabled. This way, administrators who knowingly want to allow anonymous access would need to change the setting, and maybe read some warning (see JRA-18076)
fields.summary: Add global option "Enable group <anyone>"
Add database validation to the restore/backup/startup processes
Gliffy JIRA Plugin 4.1 is ready for release in OnDemand
"Current Issues" Shortcut in JIRA Issue View.

fields.description:
h3. Step to Replicate:
# Enable Audit Logging.
# Connect JIRA to an LDAP Directory;
#* JIRA will log any User Management changes;
# Trigger another synchronization.

h4. Expected Behaviour
As per [Auditing in JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Auditing+in+JIRA], the Audit Logs would show that the directory was synchronized.

h4. Actual Behaviour
Nothing else is logged.
fields.summary: Audit Log doesn't log LDAP synchronization events
Remove Agile issue web panel from non-Agile issues

fields.description:
The action attach screenshot on a detail page (attach.screenshot.title)  shows "Attach screenshot" as text although language is set to german.
The following popup title (attach.screenshot.dialog.title) uses the correct translation "Screenshot anhängen.
Field keys were found with InProduct translation Plugin.
https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.translations.jira.inproduct

The missing field key cannot be found on Atlassians translation page
https://translations.atlassian.com/dashboard/translate#/11/7185/undefined/ALL/ALL/attach

Key: attach.screenshot.specify.image
Here it should be listed!
Key: attachfile.applet.configuration.error
fields.summary: Translation missing for attach screenshot action in de_DE language pack

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39904].
  {panel}

At the moment, you are able to know the status history of an issue. 

However, if there are 2 transitions with the same source and destination status, information about which transition the issue went through is not displayed. 

It will only show that the issue went from Status A to Status B but no information about whether it used Transition1 or Transition2 to do so.

It would be better if such information was displayed
fields.summary: Display information of which transition issue went through

fields.description:
A user is able to convert an issue to Epic without the need for Epic name.

An issue can be converted to an Epic without Epic name, under the following scenarios.
*Issue Navigator*
1. Bring the Edit dialog of an issue using the . dialog.
2. Change the issue type to Epic.
*Rapid Board*
1. Bring the Edit dialog of an issue using the . dialog.
2. Change the issue type to Epic.
*View Issue Page*
1. On the View issue page, inline edit the issue type to Epic.

Note that if the Edit button is click on the View Issue page and the issue type changed to Epic, then Epic Name field is marked as mandatory.
fields.summary: When an issue is converted to an Epic, there is no mandate to enter the Epic Name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39898].
  {panel}

I have a user ID that I made inactive after creating a new user and name that aligns to our naming standards.  The old user name is not associated with any groups and does not have any access enabled (removed his license).

To reproduce the problem:
While looking at a task/issue/etc, try to add the user as a watcher.  Using the auto-lookup, type in the name and then you'll see the name appear.  In my instance, the example is "Sofaine", you'll see two IDs appear.  The Sof4Real is the 'old' ID.

Please ensure inactive users (those with no application access are not visible in the dropdown/selection lists.

Note:  If I select the 'old' ID, the system tells me the user has no permission to see the issue.
fields.summary: Inactive user appears in dropdown selection of users to add as watcher
As a user, I want an option to always display my username in the header
Two Dimensional Filter Gadget should include Epic Link field
Update 6.3 Stable to bundle Service Desk 2.0.2
Wallboard Color Customization

fields.description:
When sending an email from the admin tool Send E-Mail and I set the Message Type to "Text" I expect the message body will be pure plain text. But instead it sends a source code of the HTML version with a lot of space at the beginning so it looks like an empty email body at first look.
Sending the mail in HTML is OK.
fields.summary: Send E-Mail admin tool: if Message Type set to "Text" the message sends HTML code instead of plain text

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39892].
  {panel}

It is possible to add the "Linked Issues" field to the screen associated to the "Edit Screen" operation, however, it doesn't show the issues that are already linked to the issue, so, if you want to remove an issue that is linked to it, you need to remove it in the Issue Links session. When editing an issue, you can only add new issue links, but not remove any of them.

It would be a great feature if we could remove issue links while editing an issue.

See attached screenshot for reference.

!issue_link.png!

!issue_link_edit_screen.png!
fields.summary: Add the ability to remove issue links when editing an issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39891].
  {panel}

There are two CSV import methods for on demand that cause regular confusion because of the visibility and lack of detail on the starting pages for each.
# selecting *Issues* > Import Issues from CSV
#  Under JIRA Administration > System. Under IMPORT & EXPORT > External System Import > select Import from Comma-separated Values (CSV)

The First is the more visible to the customer but does not import projects only bulk issues, and often gets confused with the other import method.  

I would suggest on both Screens a link to the documentation related to each method of import:
# selecting *Issues* > Import Issues from CSV:
- Link to:
-  https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Creating+issues+using+the+CSV+importer
# Under JIRA Administration > System. Under IMPORT & EXPORT > External System Import > select Import from Comma-separated Values (CSV)
- Link To:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Importing+Data+from+CSV

AND... Put a not on the First Method for *Bulk Create Setup* page to note that it does not import projects.  Currently States:
{quote}
To import issues in bulk, you need to provide the data in a CSV file format.
{quote}
Suggest adding:
{quote}
To import issues in bulk, you need to provide the data in a CSV file format.  
Note: Cannot import projects, use *External System Import* in Administration panel for project imports.
{quote}
fields.summary: Information on CSV import screens
Improve ability to change order of Favorite Dashboards

fields.description:
Just what the summary states, dashboards built on filters that are verified "shared with everyone" are not found when searching for them in manage dashboards > search.

I've tried searching for the exact dashboard name, doing an empty search, searching for all boards by xxx user - none of these return the dashboards being searched for.

If I am supplied a direct link to the dashboard, my user is able to view the dashboard validating that it has been shared with everyone and is viewable. If I favorite the dashboard, then return to the dashboard search page, the dashboard then is returned in searches. 

If I then unfavorite the dashboard, the dashboard remains searchable and is returned in empty set searches as a dashboard shared with everyone.
fields.summary: Shared dashboard not returned in search until marked favorite

fields.description:
The GET request made to /rest/applinks/1.0/applicationlink is limited to jira-administrators while this is not really needed.

First, this is a read-only operation, that returns information about linked apps, nothing really private.

Why this has to be available to jira-users instead of jira-adminstrators?
Because in order to create a remote link using the REST API you need to specify information that is returned from the applicationlink call.

Currently this bug is breaking python-jira when is used by a non-admin user, see https://bitbucket.org/bspeakmon/jira-python/issue/119/non-admins-cannot-use-the-add_remote_link
fields.summary: applicationlink REST call is restricted to jira-administrators instead of jira-users

fields.description: Using 'on the fly' creation for Version and Affect Version in screen for creating a new issue  is allowed to add a new version with the same name, which could lead a lot of inconsistency . Please, could you fix it Thanks in advance
fields.summary: Version duplication using "on the fly" creation feature for Affects Version/s and Fix Version/s

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*

# Add https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+Fix+Out+of+Memory+Errors+by+Increasing+Available+Memory#HowtoFixOutofMemoryErrorsbyIncreasingAvailableMemory-SettingPropertiesforWindowsServicesviatheWindowsRegistry inside panel macro

End result:
!bugbug.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Long links are not wrapped correctly inside the panel macro causing them to overflow from the container

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39880].
  {panel}

The ability to see all users in the User Pick list and Auto-Suggest fields should be limited to specific groups/roles specified by the admin on an instance of JIRA.

Below are are three examples of where this is an issue:

* When searching for user or reporter in issue navigator all users are visible in the auto-suggest field.  Only users that have the same project access as the user conducting the search should be visible/available for selection.  See Issue_Navigator.png

* When searching for a user using the User Picker all users in the system are visible, regardless of project.  Only users that have the same project access as the user conducting the search should be visible/available for selection.  See User_Picker.png

* When selecting watcher for an issue all of the users in the system are visible regardless of project access.  Only users that have the same project access as the user conducting the search should be visible/available for selection.  See Watcher_Auto-Suggest.png

This should function the same as when a user is selecting an assignee of an issue for a specific project.  If a user only has access to one project, they will only have the option to select a user that has access to that same project.
fields.summary: User Pick List and User Auto-Suggest drop-downs should be accessible only to certain roles/groups

fields.description:
Administration > Send Email
To: Groups
Body: <some text>
Subject: <some subject>
Message Type: Text

I expect JIRA to send plain text message which contains only <some text>. However it includes plenty of HTML tags and message <some text> is hidden in wood of HTML, with two useless pictures - avatar of administrator and logo of Atlassian. 

Example message is attached.
fields.summary: Plain text email full of HTML code

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39876].
  {panel}

Every time we plan a sprint we find it painful that we have to click on every issue in order to see how much time remains on a particular ticket.

Just as in the attached picture the highlighted ticket shows 4 days estimate, which we don't care that much any more. Instead we would like to see the remaining time on the ticket, which in this case is 2 days.

This is *particularly useful* when we decide which tickets to kick out of the sprint when we go over the available capacity for the sprint.

Also see: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/5277461/agile-board-in-plan-mode---how-to-show-remaining-alongside-estimate
fields.summary: Agile board in Plan Mode - show 'Remaining' alongside 'Estimate' column

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39875].
  {panel}

Hello!  I love using the quick menus, but I find it frustrating that no matter what I do, it always navigates away from the current tab.  

As an administrator, I often find myself finding issues with our deployment, and wanting to jump to the administration side of things, but keep the context of the problem.  We've recently upped from JIRA 5, where I believe this was possible.

Ideally, if a quick menu's option results in navigation to a url, I'd like:
# Shift + (Left-Click OR Enter) = Open a new window to the url
# Ctrl + (Left-Click OR Enter)  = Open a new tab to the url
fields.summary: Unable to open links in the 'quick' menus(gg, '.', '.') new windows/tabs

fields.description:
We are using JIRA with a custom Seraph authenticator. Basicall, as described on JRA-27280, our SSO service sets a cookie in the browser session and the Seraph plugin looks for that cookie and automatically logs in the correct user in the JIRA internal user dictionary. If the user does not yet exist there, it is created with a random password (it should be unused).

The problem is now the Mobile GUI. This one seems to not correctly pass all requests through the Seraph Authenticator:
- If you click on log in in the mobile GUI, it shows JIRA Mobile's own username/password field, and does not redirect the user to the configured SSO (as defined in seraph-config.xml). As the internal database has a random password, you cannot log in. Also the login request is not passed to SeraphAuthenticators method that takes username/password. So you have no possibility to intercept the login or authorize the user.
- If you sign in to the external provider before entering JIRA mobile (so the cookie is available and SeraphAuthenticator can report the user back to JIRA), the results are like that: Issues, restricted to users logged in, are now shown correctly. You can also add comments or watch them, So Seraph seems to work here, but in other parts of the GUI it still thinks that you are not logged in. E.g. on the left sidebar the links to "my issues" redirect you to the incorrect login screen. Also it shows "Not logged in" on the left sidebar.

The only workaround at the moment is to disable JIRA mobile plugin for our installation, which is not nice for mobile users.
fields.summary: JIRA Mobile UI bypasses Seraph Authentication, making it unuseable with such systems

fields.description:
h4. Summary
According to the [Sharing your workflow|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Sharing+your+workflow] documentation (_step number 7_), *screen(s)* and *custom field(s)* that are associated in the workflow will also be exported.

However, within this bug if a screen was associated to a transition through *Workflow Designer - Diagram Mode*, the workflow export will not include that screen(s) and its custom field(s) into the {{exported-worflow.jwb}} file

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom workflow, screen and custom field
# Associate the screen into a transition
Use the *Workflow Designer - Diagram Mode* to associate the screen
# Export the custom workflow
# *Note* in the .jwb export file, there is no files for screen(s) or custom field(s)

h4. Expected Results
Workflow, screen and custom field will be exported together in the {{*.jwb}} file

h4. Actual Results
Both screen(s) and custom field(s) are not exported

h4. Workaround
Instead of associating the screen to a transition through *Diagram Mode*, do it while in *Text Mode*
!addscreen.png|thumbnail!
!edit.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Workflow Sharing Plugin does not export associated screen and custom field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39872].
  {panel}

When I click on one of the Labels in Single Level Group by Report, Issue Navigator opens but it is immediately redirected to the last search instead of the search that was supposed to be done by clicking on the label.

If I have a link like this: 
_secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true& amp;jqlQuery=project+%3D+netaxs+AND+assignee+%3D+E496796_
and I change  *&amp;* to *&* or place *reset* attribute to the end of the url the Issue navigator opens with correct search.
fields.summary: Clicking on Labels in Single Level Group By Report redirects me to the last search in Issue Navigator
"No issues were found to match your search" displays while doing a long search

fields.description:
It seems that there is a bug in the jTDS driver within JIRA, related to SSL connections to SQL Server, see here:
* http://sourceforge.net/p/jtds/bugs/725/

h4. Problem
JIRA attempting to connect to SQL Server over SSL results in {{Network error IOException: Connection reset}}.
* JIRA is running with Java 1.8
* JIRA is using jtds driver
* Logs show:
{code}
2014-09-03 22:50:45,342 localhost-startStop-1 ERROR      [NoModule] Error getting datasource via DBCP: JdbcDatasourceInfo{uri='jdbc:jtds:sqlserver://ipaddress:443/jiradb;ssl=true', driverClassName='net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.Driver', username='jirauser', password='********', isolationLevel='null', connectionProperties=null, connectionPoolInfo=ConnectionPoolInfo{maxSize=20, minSize=20, initialSize=null, maxIdle=20, maxWait=30000, sleepTime=300000, lifeTime=600000, deadLockMaxWait=600000, deadLockRetryWait=10000, validationQuery='select 1', minEvictableTimeMillis=60000, timeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis=300000, poolPreparedStatements=null, testOnBorrow=null, testOnReturn=null, testWhileIdle=true, maxOpenPreparedStatements=null, numTestsPerEvictionRun=null, removeAbandonedTimeout=300, validationQueryTimeout=null, defaultCatalog=null}}
org.apache.commons.dbcp.SQLNestedException: Cannot create PoolableConnectionFactory (Network error IOException: Connection reset)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp.BasicDataSource.createPoolableConnectionFactory(BasicDataSource.java:1549)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp.BasicDataSource.createDataSource(BasicDataSource.java:1388)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp.BasicDataSource.setLogWriter(BasicDataSource.java:1134)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.transaction.DBCPConnectionFactory.getConnection(DBCPConnectionFactory.java:109)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.ConnectionFactory.tryGenericConnectionSources(ConnectionFactory.java:69)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.transaction.JNDIFactory.getConnection(JNDIFactory.java:146)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.TransactionFactory.getConnection(TransactionFactory.java:101)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.ConnectionFactory.getConnection(ConnectionFactory.java:59)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.ConnectionFactory$1.getConnection(ConnectionFactory.java:52)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil.getConnection(DatabaseUtil.java:132)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil.getTableNames(DatabaseUtil.java:903)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil.checkDb(DatabaseUtil.java:166)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil.checkDb(DatabaseUtil.java:144)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.checkDb(GenericDAO.java:1315)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericHelperDAO.checkDataSource(GenericHelperDAO.java:270)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.initialiseAndCheckDatabase(GenericDelegator.java:236)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.<init>(GenericDelegator.java:167)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator$1.load(GenericDelegator.java:91)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator$1.load(GenericDelegator.java:88)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$LoadingValueReference.loadFuture(LocalCache.java:3573)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.loadSync(LocalCache.java:2350)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.lockedGetOrLoad(LocalCache.java:2313)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.get(LocalCache.java:2228)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.get(LocalCache.java:3970)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.getOrLoad(LocalCache.java:3974)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$LocalManualCache.get(LocalCache.java:4834)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$LocalManualCache.getUnchecked(LocalCache.java:4839)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.getGenericDelegator(GenericDelegator.java:105)
	at com.atlassian.core.ofbiz.CoreFactory.getGenericDelegator(CoreFactory.java:38)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.database.DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.configureOfbiz(DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.java:237)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.database.DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.doNowOrEnqueue(DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.java:321)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.database.DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.doNowOrWhenDatabaseConfigured(DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.java:220)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.postDbLaunch(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:106)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.access$100(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:31)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher$1.run(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:78)
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.devspeed.JiraDevSpeedTimer.run(JiraDevSpeedTimer.java:34)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.start(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:73)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.LauncherContextListener.contextInitialized(LauncherContextListener.java:71)  <+5> (StandardContext.java:4992) (StandardContext.java:5490) (LifecycleBase.java:150) (ContainerBase.java:1575) (ContainerBase.java:1565)

	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: Network error IOException: Connection reset
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.ConnectionJDBC2.<init>(ConnectionJDBC2.java:395)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.ConnectionJDBC3.<init>(ConnectionJDBC3.java:50)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.Driver.connect(Driver.java:184)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp.DriverConnectionFactory.createConnection(DriverConnectionFactory.java:38)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp.PoolableConnectionFactory.makeObject(PoolableConnectionFactory.java:582)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp.BasicDataSource.createPoolableConnectionFactory(BasicDataSource.java:1545)
	... 46 more
Caused by: java.net.SocketException: Connection reset
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(Unknown Source)
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(Unknown Source)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.ssl.TdsTlsInputStream.readFully(TdsTlsInputStream.java:131)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.ssl.TdsTlsInputStream.primeBuffer(TdsTlsInputStream.java:100)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.ssl.TdsTlsInputStream.read(TdsTlsInputStream.java:78)
	at sun.security.ssl.InputRecord.read(Unknown Source)
	at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.readRecord(Unknown Source)
	at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.performInitialHandshake(Unknown Source)
	at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.startHandshake(Unknown Source)
	at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.startHandshake(Unknown Source)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.ssl.SocketFactories$TdsTlsSocketFactory.createSocket(SocketFactories.java:101)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.SharedSocket.enableEncryption(SharedSocket.java:337)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.TdsCore.negotiateSSL(TdsCore.java:548)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.ConnectionJDBC2.<init>(ConnectionJDBC2.java:351)
	... 52 more
{code}

h4. Workaround
* Switch the Java version used to 1.7
* Turn off SSL
* Use Microsoft's JDBC drivers.
* Use this patch: http://sourceforge.net/p/jtds/patches/129/
fields.summary: Java 1.8 and jTDS Sql Server SSL Connection Issues
Add a 'Customer' user permission in JIRA that doesn't count towards the license

fields.description:
Hi,
we have French version of JIRA (5.2), and values of Priority field in German are :
Blokiert, Grossjährig,Bergarbeiter witch means Blocked, Teenager, Miners.

Thanks for your help to have the right translation.
fields.summary: Values of Priority field are not well translated in German

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39863].
  {panel}

When you edit an issue's description on the task's page (eg. https://project.atlassian.net/browse/ID-001) and you want to save your changes, so you press Ctrl+S which brings up the save dialog in the latest Chrome. Ok, that's not you wanted, so you press the Escape button and you've lost your changes. It's very counterintuitive.

Suggestions:
  - map Ctrl+S to save changes
  - or if the user made changes don't discard them without any warning
  - (not prefered) or somehow block save dialog Esc to discard the changes
fields.summary: Issue editing, Ctrl+S brings up save dialog then Esc discards the changes

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce the problem:
# Add a comment with the following format:
{code}
Hi [~admin],

Please find the Messsage attachment below:

h5. [^message(1).avi]

Thanks & Regards,
John
{code}
# I can received the notification:
!notification-attachment.png|thumbnail!
# When I click on the attachment link, it brings me to the following URL:
{code}
http://secure/attachment/10100/10100_message%281%29.avi
{code}

So if the Base URL is missing and it's clear that we cannot open the attachment directly from the email.
fields.summary: Attachment links in emails do not contain base url

Hi I was wondering it could  be possible to create project role schemes.

 Because we have a big company with lot of projects (more then 250 now and expanding) we have different methods. We use the agile way of working but also the waterfall way of working. It is hard for project leads (who aren't technical) to determine which role the have to fill in. (also because we have some workflows which have role based transactions,)

also for test management we use this and have therefor also created different roles. Now everyone sees there all project roles. That isn't quite fancy and usefull. Can you help with this.

Thanks in advance.

Improved credential data in cwd_application table for Crowd

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a delegated LDAP directory has 'Copy User on Login' enabled at one point it persists the 'User Object Filter' in the database. Even if you disable the 'Copy User on Login' check box it will still check users against that filter when they attempt to login. If the filter is incorrect, it will prevent users from logging in.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Delegated LDAP Directory without Copy User on Login.
# Create the user and login as them. Verify this works.
# Enable the 'Copy User on Login' tick box.
# Attempt to login and verify the login works.
# Change the 'User Object Filter' so that it won't work, for example:
{noformat}
(&(objectCategory=Person)(sAMAccountName=potato))
{noformat}
# Disable 'Copy User on Login'.
# Attempt to login.

h3. Expected Results

As 'Copy User on Login' is disabled the 'User Object Filter' will not be applied and the user can login.

h3. Actual Results

The user is not able to login.

h3. Workaround

Either of the following:

* Enable the 'Copy User on Login' functionality and update the 'User Object Filter' so that it is correct, then disable it.
* Delete and recreate the User Directory without the 'Copy User on Login' functionality enabled. *This will delete all users and groups in that directory*.
fields.summary: Delegated User Directory will still use the User Object Filter when Copy User on Login is Disabled
Ability to group filters into sub-menus on JIRA Issues menu

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39852].
  {panel}

Different from the creation issue moment, when you have a *validator* requiring a field into the workflow and this field is not filled, the attachment will be lost when you click in the button to transition the issue.

Steps to reproduce:
- Create a Custom Field (*Test Checklist*)
- In an active workflow create a Workflow Validator (*Required Field: Test Checklist*)
- Perform the workflow transition as you can see on the following link:
!attachment.png!
- Attach the attachment without fill the *Test Checklist* field.

You'll receive an error message and the attachment will be lost.

It's important because there is no way to discover which fields are required before you click to transition the issue, in this process the attachment will be lost.
fields.summary: Lost attachment when a required field is left blank in a workflow transition
Enable Application Link Issue Links Translation
Leaving required field empty when changing task type from "New Feature" to "Epic"

fields.description:
In the versions management screen of the project administration.

When entering an invalid date, using a valid format, the validation message is not quite clear.

Example : version release date is set to october 31 (in my case, "31.09.14"). Change the month to september (without using the picker), it becomes "31.09.2014". Which is invalid because september only has 30 days.

The validation message is only "Please enter the date in the following format: dd.MM.yy"

It would be nice to distinguish between the pure formatting problems (if you would enter "30 july 2014" in a field that expects dd.MM.yy) and the date validity problem (31 september is not a valid date). Or if not easily feasible, make the error message a bit more general.
fields.summary: Date validation in versions management: error message unclear

fields.description:
In JIRA, if the Swedish language pack(JIRA-6.1.6-language-pack-sv_SE.jar) is used, the following error shows up in the browser console :

Calendar._SDN is undefined


When users try to edit the project versions, then the update button is missing.
fields.summary: Calendar._SDN is undefined error in Swedish language pack

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39845].
  {panel}

If a project is restricted to a particular group(s), users that are not in these groups should not be able to view the properties on the project as well. 

For example, Project A has custom field and status with the name 'Test' and 'Testing' respectively. 

*Current behavior*
Users are able to look for the custom field and status in JQL by typing status =, then all status will be in suggestion list.

*Expected behavior*
Users that are restricted from the project cannot search the custom field and status in JQL.
fields.summary: Restrict properties of a project

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce
# Navigate to attachments page 
# Click _Edit Settings_ link. Edit Attachment Settings will pop up
# Check the _Disable attachments_ option and _Update_ 
!editattachments1.png|thumbnail!
# Revoke user permission to the attachments directory
!editattachments2.png|thumbnail!
# Click _Edit Settings_ link. Edit Attachment Settings will pop up
# Check the _Use Default Directory_ option and click _Update_
!editattachments3.png|thumbnail!

h4. Expected results
# Unable to update. Edit Attachment Settings pop up will not close
# Error/Warning message should appear in the UI
# Error/Warning message should appear in the logs

h4. Actual Results
# Unable to update. Edit Attachment Settings pop up will not close
# No error/warning message in the UI
# No error/warning message in the logs
# No error/warning message anywhere
fields.summary: No warning/errors are displayed on Enabling Attachments when the user has no permission to write permissions on the attachments directory

fields.description:
Seems similar to JRA-18113, JRA-17984, JRA-16697
I had this issue 2-3 times so far, but currently unable to reproduce consistenly.

Repro:
* Create issue without a Description
* Open the issue and start editing the Description
* While in edit mode (in Description field), click on 'Edit' button on the issue itself
* Update the issue and click OK
* Description field is now empty again. Content was not saved it seems.

What I would expect:
When clicking the Edit button (same be havior as clicking outside the Description field to trigger save) the Description is saved and edit pop-up is opened.

Version: v6.1.3#6158-sha1:b5b5eab
 Browser: Firefox 24ESR
fields.summary: Contents of issue Description lost while in edit mode and performing Edit on the issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary
User can browse projects although they are not granted with the 'Browse Projects' permission

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure the following permissions via the Permissions Scheme:
#* 'Create Issues' permission to Anyone
#* 'Browse Projects' permission to certain group (example: Group A)
# Login as user that is not in Group A
# Create an issue via Create Issue screen

h3. Expected Results
User should not be able to create issues in the projects that he is not allowed to view

h3. Actual Results
Issues will be created successfully regardless of projects but he will not be able to view it. 

!permissions.png!
fields.summary: User are able to browse projects even without the "Browse Projects" permission
NPE in console when sysadmin views project overview

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39838].
  {panel}

As a user working in our JIRA instances for several years, 
When I do a search, 
I do not want to be inundated with hundreds or a thousand records meeting my search. 

In this case, we have very few technical, power users; we have hundreds of non technical users who do searches to try and locate what they need.  Therefore, they are not going to remember how to use various functions to locate the information.   We want to be able to not allow our search to search across issues in archived versions so that they are searching more recent information.    We do not want to move issues from one project to another archived project because: 
1) You have to setup all the versions, components, issue types, screens, in the archived project to be able to support the move of thousands of issues from one project to another
2) You would have to create another field to populate (which, if closed, you would need to modify the workflows to be able to edit) so that you can indicate the original project for reporting purposes - especially for financial audits relating to sw capitalization that we have to show the stories/features that were worked on that have associated time and they all need to tie together. 
3) You would have to go back and edit versions to make them unique to avoid conflicts. 

Thus, keeping such issues in the original project is beneficial when its needed; but, the majority of individuals only want to deal with current work and backlogs - not issues that were closed 5-7 years ago.  

You may already have this suggestion logged; but, I have the same issue when trying to search your own db's - I get so many results, I give up looking and log what I need - that is the same thing that happens to us and creates unnecessary noise and confusion.
fields.summary: Archive issues and not include in search
Created vs. Resolved Gadget configured for "weekly" grouping calculates weeks using default locale rather than instance configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39836].
  {panel}

In JIRA OnDemand there's a new plugin that manages the attachments - *Atlassian BlobStore Client Plugin*. 

This plugin is currently not available for JIRA Server (Behind the Firewall), and when migrating JIRA from Cloud (OnDemand) to Server (BTF) JIRA is not able to display attachments. It throws a 500 error instead.

h4. Steps to Replicate the Problem:
# Export a JIRA Cloud backup;
# Install JIRA Server 6.3.4;
# And restore the Cloud backup (XML + /data/ folder);
# Try to access an attachment.

h4. Expected Behavior:
The attachments is displayed correctly.

h4. Actual Behavior:
JIRA shows a 500 error page. In the logs, the following is thrown:
{noformat:borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#6A8EB3 |bgColor=#F8F8F8}
2014-09-04 19:10:20,824 http-bio-8080-exec-1 ERROR jtabeling 1150x15324x1 1xp3ogl 192.168.10.XX,127.0.0.1 /secure/attachment/10405/MyScreenshot.png [jira.web.servlet.ViewAttachmentServlet] Error serving file for path /10405/MyScreenshot.png: BlobStore Client Plugin not loaded
java.lang.IllegalStateException: BlobStore Client Plugin not loaded
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.attachment.BlobStoreAttachmentStore.getBlobStore(BlobStoreAttachmentStore.java:45)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.attachment.BlobStoreAttachmentStore.get(BlobStoreAttachmentStore.java:57)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround:
As per [Accessing Attachments show a 500 error page after migration from OnDemand|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Accessing+Attachments+show+a+500+error+page+after+migration+from+OnDemand], please:
# Access the Dark Features page in the JIRA Server through _http://<jira-address>/secure/admin/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa_
# Disable the {{com.atlassian.jira.FS_ATTACHMENTS_PRIMARY}} dark feature.
fields.summary: BlobStore plugin dark features in OnDemand causes Attachments to display a 500 error in JIRA when migrating from OD to Server
Allow the "Issue Links" panel to be configured as always visible
BitBucket Imports Causes 500 Internal Error When Adding Or Editing Email Address

fields.description:
When excluding issues with a specific resolution, 
like: resolution != "Won't Fix" 
Jira will exclude all unresolved issues as well. 
Expected behavior would be to find resolved issues except "Won't Fix" AND ALL unresolved issues. 

resolution != "Won't Fix" or resolution is EMPTY returns the expected result.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39823].
  {panel}

Confluence has had these for quite some time, as more people are using JIRA for things such as support (i.e. over the internet) it is becoming more pressing to have a supported means of inserting code into the header and body for things including:
* Analytics
* Real User Monitoring
* Heatmap Tracking etc

While there was a request opened for this in 2010 (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-19673)  I am hoping that it is time to revisit this, especially with the recent release of JIRA Service Desk.

It would be ideal to bring this into line with the Confluence offering which allows a simple, supported mechanism for injecting code into all the pages.
fields.summary: Custom HTML blocks for head, and end of body
Ability to create a notation for an entire role or entire team (similar to the @username)
Force HTTPS only for login and (possibly) Admin Pages
Update user CSV doc to include permission
